description: Students will be introduced to the different methods used in psychology research pertaining to the learning sciences. The learning sciences is an emerging interdisciplinary field that aims to understand learning processes and how those processes can be optimised in educational contexts. Major investigative approaches—including experimental, qualitative, replication, survey, systematic review, and meta-analytic techniques, as well as laboratory, online, and classroom research—will be addressed. This module will culminate in the opportunity to conduct learning sciences research via a group project on a topic of students’ own choosing.
title: Lab in Learning Sciences
